original_title: Sri Lanka receives first 250 mln USD from World Bank loan
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has received the first disbursement worth 250 million US dollar as a budget support loan from the World Bank, Shehan Semasinghe, State Minister of Finance said.
“We are pleased to confirm that the 1st disbursement of US$ 250 out of US$ 500 Mn for budget support from the World Bank has been received,” Minister Semasinghe tweeted.
Sri Lanka’s cabinet had given the nod to sign an agreement to borrow a 500 million US dollar budget support loan from the World Bank.
The loan would come in two tranches and is linked to structural benchmarks in the International Monetary Fund program.
The funds would come from the World Bank’s concessionary International Development Association window.

The World Bank approved $700 million in budgetary and welfare support for Sri Lanka on June 29, from the approved funds $500 million of the funds will be allocated for budgetary support while the remaining $200 million will be for welfare support to those severely impacted by the crisis. (Colombo/July04/2023)
